tier.item: `The child wanted a book (be it any).'
`The child wanted a book (be it any).'
The child wanted a book (be it any).
The child didn't read a/any book.
`The child wanted the book' or `The child wanted a specific book.'
`The child wanted the book' or `The child wanted a specific book.'
The child wanted a specific book.
The chief and the lunatic left.
b. Ici-tabo ubu-sanshi na ulu-balala fi-li ku-no
`The book, the bed, and the peanut are here.'

(27) *n-ali-mu-ya-peel-a object can become subject of a corresponding passive construction:
